comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: George Walbridge Perkins, Sr. (January 31, 1862 – June 18, 1920) was vice-president of New York Life Insurance Company and a partner in J.P. Morgan & Co. He served as president of the Palisades Interstate Park Commission from its creation in 1900 until his death in 1920. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Walbridge_Perkins

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton: Thanks for finding more information about Perkins for us.  We'll include it in our description next time we update.
